meanings.definition: A collection of literary or philosophical extracts.
meanings.sent1: The library had an analecta of famous quotes from different authors.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the analecta of poems by various poets.
meanings.sent3: The analecta of jokes made everyone laugh during the party.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an analecta of memories, each one carefully stored.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's desk was like an analecta of student essays, each one unique.

meanings.definition: A selection of passages from a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The anthology was an analecta of the author's best writings.
meanings.sent2: He found an analecta of Shakespeare's sonnets in the old bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The analecta of recipes in the cookbook made her hungry.
meanings.sent4: His speech was an analecta of famous movie quotes, making it entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed an analecta of ancient scrolls, each telling a different story.

meanings.definition: A compilation of writings or sayings.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher's notebook was an analecta of profound thoughts.
meanings.sent2: She created an analecta of inspirational quotes to motivate herself.
meanings.sent3: The analecta of proverbs on the wall reminded them of wisdom.
meanings.sent4: His journal was an analecta of personal reflections, hidden from others.
meanings.sent5: The anthology served as an analecta of historical speeches, preserving the past.
